content: The Questionnaire track kick-off meeting will be September 8th, 5-6 p.m. ET. The session should be available through Whova, though I just scheduled it, so Whova might not have it yet.
Just a reminder that the Questionnaire track kick-off call is today, 5-6 p.m. Eastern Time. The session is available through Whova: https://whova.com/portal/webapp/hlsfh_202109/Agenda/
"Missed by that much" - stupid timezones and other meetings

I'm super keen for our connectathon this time. My goals for the event are to get enable when expression working in our renderer, observation based prepop and extract, and try out some fhir mapping language experiments, what time would people like to do a 1/2 hour or hour session on the mapping language.
how about tuesday after 2pm? at 4pm is the questionnaire track check-in, or after the check-in?
id like to join but tuesday 2-4 i have another session
that's 11 pm CEST, right?
If so, I'm in

There's a new example in the spec that purports to support expression-based population and definition-based extraction. Would be great if it could be tested to make sure it's working correctly :) http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/sdc/Questionnaire-demographics.html

Brian Postlethwaite said:

what time would people like to do a 1/2 hour or hour session on the mapping language.

Would that be a mapping language tutorial?
Sounds like a fun and useful thing to do
Not so much a tutorial as a dedicated testing/discussion slot on it.

I think my parser is working ok (needs checking) and conversion to StructureMap has some issues (with the StructureMap itself) and wanted to discuss these. (before really getting into an execution engine)
But happy to walk through my open parser code (C#)

@Brian Postlethwaite feel free to grab an open time slot. Note that in whova there is a typo in the Questionnaire check-in session that was supposed to be 11 AM - 12 PM, and somehow it became 11 AM - 11 PM. I have just now requested that to be fixed, but anyway there are more open time slots than that would indicate.

I am just realizing (not sure how I didn't see this before) that the 11 AM - 12PM check-in session conflicts with @Joee Garcia's talk on Gravity SDOH Exchange track- "Implementing PRAPARE with SDC and outputting Gravity IG artifacts - QuestionnaireResponse, Observation, and Conditions using StructureMap". I think that will likely be of interest to many people on the Questionnaire track, so I would like to move that check-in session. Maybe we can squeeze it in beforehand, say 10:10 AM - 10:50 AM?
Double check that Paul, the gravity session is from 10-11, and the checkin session is 11-11 ;)
Just a reminder that Questionnaire track welcome session is starting at 8:00.
Hi, 8:00 what is the timezone @Paul Lynch ?
Eastern Time
3pm eastern for the FHIR Mapping session
I was hoping for 5 as above. is it the same session we're talking about?
Ok, 5pm it is then.
oh right, Sorry Brian.... but who needs sleep anyway, right?.... right?
I'm working in the US timezone for the few days...
Reminder: Joee's walkthrough of the SDC IG is starting in a couple of minutes.
Demo sign-up page: I created a page for signing for up for one of the demo time slots: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=79497934
Next up: "Check-in" session 10:10-10:50 (ET).
At 11:00 ET, we will not be having the check-in session scheduled then, because many of us would like to see Joee's talk on the Gravity SDOH Exchange track.
Next up: Overview of NLM open-source tools for Questionnaire (1:00-2:00 p.m. Eastern Time)
Starting in two minutes (1:05)...
Next up: Questionnaire check-in session, in two minutes, 4:00-5:00 PM Eastern Time.
is it 5 pm already?
Yes, it is. Were you going to join the session for a discussion about mapping?
yes
where is it?
whova. Pick a session and join.
It is the same zoom session (for any Questionnaire track session)
Starting now (8:00-9:00 a.m., Eastern Time): "Check-in" session for questions or collaboration
1st demo session starting now (9:00-10:00)
Next up: "Check-in Session", 1:00-2:00 Eastern time.

Also, as a reminder, there is a second demo session scheduled from 3:00-4:00 Eastern Time. If you are interested in demoing something then, please sign up at https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=79497934 so we have an idea of how many people might be demoing.
I'll be showing the Observation based $extract which was implemented during the connectathon
Starting in 7 minutes (3:00 p.m. Eastern Time - 4:00): Demo session 2, with a demo by Brian (and possibly others, if anyone would like to demo something Questionnaire-related).
Next up: 4:00 p.m. -5:00 p.m. Eastern Time (2 minutes from now): A final check-in session
was the demo from this morning recorded?
I want to replay Oliver's instructions
No, sorry. The only session that was recorded was the SDC IG walkthrough.
